Empathetic Artificial Intelligence

1) Empathetic AI

1.1) What is Empathy ?

Empathy is the ability to understand the feeling of something.

1.2) What is AI?

Artificial intelligence is intelligence in machines,that is almost equal to natural intelligence displayed by us humans.

1.3) What is Empathetic AI?

It is a is the development of robots/systems that are powered by AI that are able to detect and respond to human emotions in an empathetic way.

1.3.1) What would be achieved by AE (Artificial Empathy) ?

  • If AI can understand our feelings, they would now know our pain. And this will decrease the chances of AI being harmful to humans as they would understand what would happen if they hurt one, they would understand the effect of hurting someone.
  • It can also understand one's feeling in a more accurate manner/way based on the tone and facial expressions. Also it will respond more accurately. If It is able to understand Facial Expressions, it would also be able understand one's mood, and try to take over the driving and make the person relax.
  • Based on where the person is looking, it can know whether one is seeing a device to work or busy in some other things, and if necessary, AI automobile system can take over.

    • 1.4) Ongoing use / Applications in practice.

    With the increasing use of the 3 domains of AI, there have been many applications using Empathetic AI. An example is Affectiva, which is a company that is making AI based software for human emotion and action recognition.

1.5) Will this be a boon or a curse in the coming days?

So Based on my views, It would be a boon

2) Empathetic Chatbots

2.1) Can AI chatbots help fill the empathy gap?

Y es! Why not? Chatbots can convey Empathy & Emotions, and interact with people to solve their problems that require human-like emotions.
Turning to a chatbot for emotional support might help if a person is feeling depressed/stresed.
Associate Professor of Communication Jingbo, Meng wanted to see just how effective artificial intelligence chatbots could be in delivering supportive messages.
She set up the research and used a chatbot development platform to test it out. This is what she said:
Chatbots have been widely applied in customer service through text- or voice-based communication, It’s a natural extension to think about how AI chatbots can play a role in providing empathy after listening to someone’s stories and concerns.
In early 2019, Meng began assessing the effectiveness of empathic chatbots by comparing them with human chat. She had been following the growth of digital healthcare and wellness apps, and saw the phenomenal growth of those related to mental health.
Meng recruited 278 MSU undergraduates for her study, and asked them to identify major stressors they had experienced in the past month. Participants were then connected through Facebook Messenger with an empathetic chat partner. One group was told they would be talking with a chatbot, another understood they would be talking with a human. Why? Meng wanted to know how did the students react on knowing the reponder, human or chatbot. Some chatbots shared their own experiences as way to evoke empathy. Other chatbots simply expounded on their own personal problems at the expense of not validating the participants.
It's always said that everyone don't share their info with everyone. We humans usually prefer to share our feelings with someone who guarantees that information will not be told to anyone and any point of time. In this condition the students knew with whom they were sharing their information. The students who shared the information with humans, they felt insecure and thought that whatever they told can be passed to other people also, but the people who were told that they were talking with a chatbot, they told everything free-ly, and got relieved at the end. This proved that chatbots are better than human counselors.

2.2) Will chatbots take place of Human counselors?

Yes, absolutely.
